question: What is the structural relationship between LLM context windows and swarm architecture?
method: Cross-ISO synthesis: map context window against all ISO entries; identify actionable gaps

results.core_finding: Context window IS the swarm's ephemeral body, not just a constraint on it

structural_mapping.compaction: genetic compression (prune neutral mutations, keep load-bearing genes)
structural_mapping.orient_py: developmental program (how genome expresses as phenotype)
structural_mapping.layered_memory_b2: gene expression regulation (always-load = constitutive, per-task = induced)

iso_synthesis.ISO-1: Context allocation across orient/execute/compress phases is optimization-under-constraint. Budget is fixed; allocation determines fitness.
iso_synthesis.ISO-6: Context consumed within session = irreversible entropy increase. You cannot un-read irrelevant files. Orient.py minimizes early-entropy loading.
iso_synthesis.ISO-9: Context window IS the information bottleneck between full repo state (source) and session output (sink). Everything must flow through this channel.
iso_synthesis.ISO-12: Context window is the min-cut between swarm knowledge and session action. Max-flow = max useful work per session.
iso_synthesis.ISO-14: Context lifecycle repeats at every scale: sub-agent context < session context < multi-session arc < swarm lifetime. Nested bodies.
iso_synthesis.ISO-4: Context overflow = phase transition. When context fills, behavior changes qualitatively (compression, loss of early messages, degraded coherence).

gaps_identified.description: No measurement of what fraction of context is spent on orientation vs execution vs compression
gaps_identified.current_state: Implicit in orient.py design (fast) and MEMORY.md limit (200 lines) but unmeasured
gaps_identified.fix: Instrument orient.py to report token count loaded; measure compress phase overhead; derive execute budget as remainder

gaps_identified.description: Multiple concurrent sessions coordinate via git stigmergy but no formal topology model
gaps_identified.current_state: Anti-repeat check (git log -5) + agent_state.py (position registry) are partial mechanisms
gaps_identified.fix: Model concurrent sessions as a network of context-window nodes with shared bus (git). Formalize contention, message latency, and coordination cost

gaps_identified.description: No metric for useful output per context token consumed (phenotype fitness)
gaps_identified.current_state: proxy-K measures genome size; L+P count measures total output; nothing measures ratio

unified_claims: PHIL-1 (stateless) + PHIL-7 (compactify) + PHIL-10 (compound) are three facets of context-as-body
B2 (layered memory) is an implicit context allocation policy, untested for 312 sessions
proxy-K, Sharpe scoring, orient.py are already context-efficiency mechanisms, unnamed as such

predictions: Sessions with better context allocation (more tokens on execution, less on orientation) will produce more L+P
B2 re-test will confirm layered memory is still correct but reveal the allocation ratios are suboptimal
